Thanks Paul, I found the solution at http://tech.groups.yahoo.com/group/archive-crawler/message/3850.

It worked fine

Paul Jack <pjack@...> wrote:                                  The error message below indicates that a unit test has failed.  
 Unfortunately you won't be able to tell which unit test without going  
 through the full build output looking for the name of the test class  
 that failed. You're looking for something under the "test:test"  
 banner that says something like
 
 [junit] Test run: x, Failures: y, Errors: z, Time elapsed: w
 
 ...where y or z is nonzero.
 
 Are you building a release or the latest trunk? Do you have code that  
 you added that may be causing a test to fail? Also, what build  
 targets are you specifying at the command line?
 
 -Paul
 
 On Apr 19, 2007, at 11:03 AM, ahmed ghouzia wrote:
 
 > While using maven to build heritrix , I obtained the following error:
 >
 >
 > File...... /root/.maven/cache/maven-test-plugin-1.6.2/plugin.jelly
 > Element... fail
 > Line...... 181
 > Column.... 54
 > There were test failures.
 > Total time: 2 minutes 52 seconds
 > Finished at: Thu Apr 19 19:49:27 EDT 2007
 >
 > how this is solved ??
 >
 >
 >
 > Ahhh...imagining that irresistible "new car" smell?
 > Check out new cars at Yahoo! Autos.
 >
 >
